title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,140.70 USD/T on January 16, 2026, down 0.93% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 8.21%, and are up 17.10% compared to the same time last year. The price reflects trading on a contract for difference tracking the benchmark market.

title: U.S. aluminum prices hit record highs amid tariffs, low supply
summary: U.S. aluminum prices have surged 40% since tariffs were raised to 50%, with the Midwest premium hitting a record high as inventories fell sharply. Global supply shortfalls and tariffs are aggravating the impact, driving LME prices up over 20% in the last 12 months. The premium exceeds costs justified by freight, taxes, and expectations of higher LME prices.

title: Aluminum price forecast for 2026, according to BCA Research
summary: Aluminum prices are expected to remain resilient short-term due to constrained Chinese primary supply and substitution from copper. However, deteriorating global manufacturing conditions in 2026 will weigh on demand and prices. Increased Chinese secondary production and overseas expansions may offset primary supply limits.

title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
summary: Aluminum steadied at $3,197.50 a ton on the LME, the highest in over three years, following a bullish run into 2026. Copper wavered around records amid concerns over softening Chinese demand and elevated geopolitical risks. Industrial metals like tin also saw gains after recent rallies.

title: Macro factors are mixed, with bullish sentiment slightly cooling in the latter part of the week
summary: Mixed macro signals and weak fundamentals persist, but liquidity support keeps aluminum prices elevated. Bullish fund sentiment has cooled slightly after Trump's tariff decision on critical minerals. SHFE aluminum is forecast at RMB 23,800-25,000 per tonne, LME at USD 3,080-3,200 per tonne next week.

title: [SMM Aluminum Alloy Daily Review] Aluminum prices correct sharply, secondary market quotations diverge amid weak demand
summary: Aluminum prices experienced another significant correction, with A00 prices falling by 160 yuan/mt. Secondary market quotations diverged amid weak demand. This reflects ongoing pressure in the aluminum alloy market.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,140.70 USD/T on January 16, 2026, amid tightening supply and production disruptions. China is curbing overcapacity, set to breach its 45 million ton output cap, while new smelters in Indonesia face setbacks. Operations at smelters in Iceland, Mozambique, and Australia are suspended due to high energy costs, equipment failures, bauxite sourcing issues, and geopolitical risks.

title: Aluminum prices soar on Trump tariffs, global shortages, and China ...
summary: Aluminum prices are soaring due to Trump's 50% tariffs and global shortages of 2 million tons per year. Century Aluminum plans to restart its Mt. Holly, SC smelter to full production, increasing U.S. output by 50,000 metric tons and creating over 100 jobs by June 2026. U.S. buyers face record spreads over global benchmarks amid reduced Chinese production and exports.

title: AMU: Labor agreement timelines converge in US aluminum
source: Steel Market Update / Aluminum Market Update
summary: Multiple collective bargaining agreements at U.S. aluminum producers are expiring or entering negotiations in 2026, potentially impacting operations. This convergence occurs amid trade protections, high aluminum prices, elevated Midwest premiums, and uneven demand. Facilities like Constellium’s Muscle Shoals and Ravenswood are approaching key bargaining phases.

title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
summary: Aluminum prices steadied at over $3,197.50 a ton, the highest in more than three years, following a bullish start to 2026. Concerns linger over softening Chinese demand and elevated geopolitical risks, including potential U.S. tariffs on countries trading with Iran. The rally follows copper's record highs amid supply constraints.

title: Aluminum Sector 2026: Strategic Plays in a Supply-Constrained World
summary: Alcoa is positioned as a leader in the 2026 aluminum sector through vertical integration, decarbonization technologies like ELYSIS™ and ASTRAEA™, and circular economy initiatives. A 10-year renewable energy deal with NYPA and $60M smelter modernization enhance its green aluminum production capabilities. These efforts align with rising demand for low-carbon aluminum amid supply constraints.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have launched the first aerosol can using 50% ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content ahead of COP30. The ELYSIS process eliminates direct GHG emissions by producing oxygen instead of carbon during smelting. This innovation supports decarbonization in packaging for personal and home care products.

title: Hydro joins Alumobility to accelerate aluminium adoption in the automotive industry
summary: Hydro has joined Alumobility to promote aluminum in automotive applications for lighter, more efficient, and sustainable vehicles. Leveraging its low-carbon production and advanced materials expertise, Hydro aims to support OEMs in meeting sustainability targets through collaboration and innovation. The partnership focuses on lightweight architectures, circularity, and knowledge sharing across the aluminum value chain.

title: The more sustainability and transparency, the better the decisions
summary: Speira advances aluminum sustainability using AI and advanced technologies in recycling, with RIVOS products combining recycled scrap and low-carbon primary metal to minimize carbon footprints. The company pushes for full circularity by closing all material loops and redefining aluminum limits through custom alloys and processing techniques. These efforts simplify recycling and enable higher recycled content in applications.

title: The Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers and Phinergy Sign Strategic Collaboration to Validate Clean Aluminum-Air Generator (AAG) for Energy Resilience in Large-Scale Data Centers
summary: The Net Zero Innovation Hub and Phinergy are collaborating to validate aluminum-air generators for zero-emission, on-demand power in data centers. The AAG technology produces clean electricity from recyclable aluminum, offering high energy density, safety, and low TCO without material loss. Supported by hyperscalers like Google and Microsoft, it enhances grid resilience for AI-driven operations.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel traded flat at around 3,138-3,141 CNY/T on January 16, 2026, marking a slight 0.10% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices rose 1.65-1.75%, though they remain 5.68-5.77% lower than a year ago. Steel rebar futures gained on hopes of China stimulus, reaching CNY 3,130 per tonne amid discussions on fiscal measures to boost demand.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 17.01.2026
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel exchanges, showing Shanghai Futures rebar prices flat at 0.00 change on January 16, 2026, for 1-3 month terms. Other futures like Turkey, China, Europe, and North America 1-month terms also held steady as of January 15, 2026. The platform highlights ongoing price monitoring amid global market dynamics.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: China's steel exports rose 6.7% from January to November 2025, with a new export licensing framework implemented on January 1, 2026, for about 300 products, expected to have marginal impact. Nucor, the largest U.S. steel producer, kept hot-rolled coil prices stable in late December 2025 after nine weeks of increases, amid extended lead times of 5-6 weeks. Indian steelmakers' shares rose 5% after a three-year tariff on select steel imports starting at 12%.

title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of January 2026
summary: Global iron and steel markets showed relative price stability during the second week of January 2026. Price movements were limited, reflecting steady conditions across key regions.

title: Ning Steel's January 2026 Product Price Policy Adjustment
summary: Ningbo Steel unveiled unchanged HRC prices for January 2026. Spot market prices for cold-rolled coils in Wuxi remained steady, with averages at 8,300 yuan/mt for 201/2B and specific levels for 304/2B.

title: Taiwan's Yusco raises stainless steel prices for Jan 2026 on surging raw material costs
summary: Yieh United Steel Corp. (Yusco), a leading Taiwanese stainless steel manufacturer, announced a substantial price increase for January 2026. The hike is driven by surging raw material costs impacting production.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Vendors report extended lead times of five to six weeks for steel due to strong demand, with seven price increases for steel pipe in 2025. Nucor, the largest U.S. steel producer, kept hot-rolled coil prices stable in late December 2025 after nine weeks of increases. China implemented a steel export licensing framework on January 1, 2026, for about 300 products, while India imposed tariffs on select steel imports from China.

title: Weekly Raw Steel Production: Week Ending January 10, 2026
summary: Domestic raw steel production reached 1,752,000 net tons in the week ending January 10, 2026, with a capability utilization rate of 75.7 percent. This marks an increase from prior periods, reflecting ongoing production trends in the U.S. steel industry. The data is estimated from about 50% of domestic capacity.

title: US-based Worthington Steel to acquire Klöckner & Co for $2.4 billion
summary: Worthington Steel announced plans to acquire Klöckner & Co for $2.4 billion, potentially impacting steel production and distribution capacities. This deal highlights consolidation trends in the global steel sector. Further details on production implications are emerging.

title: Ferrexpo reduced production by 9% y/y in 2025
summary: Ukrainian producer Ferrexpo reported a 9% year-on-year decline in production for 2025, affecting steel-related output. This reduction comes amid ongoing market challenges. The news was published in the context of recent steel market updates.

title: Steel Prices in the Second Week of January 2026
summary: Global iron and steel markets showed relative price stability during the second week of January 2026, with limited fluctuations. This stability influences production planning and capacity utilization decisions. The report covers key market segments.

title: Tata Steel Nederland Opens New Production Line for Sustainable Food Packaging
summary: Tata Steel Nederland has commissioned a new production line using innovative TCCT (Trivalent Chromium Coating Technology) for more sustainable packaging steel production, complying with future legislation. This patented technology, combined with Protact®, enhances food safety, reduces costs by eliminating extra lacquer layers, and simplifies supply chains. It sets a new European standard for eco-friendly steel packaging.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel Industry
summary: Fujitsu is conducting a demonstration experiment selected for METI's FY2025 project to track green steel's environmental value through the supply chain using blockchain, ensuring secure data distribution and transaction confidentiality. The initiative, running from December 2025 to February 2026, addresses challenges in distributing CO2 reduction benefits from green steel production. It aims to promote decarbonization in steel and manufacturing via sustainable supply chains.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. green steel production is advancing with technologies like electric arc mini-mills using recycled scrap and innovations from startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra, reducing emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Hertha's coal-free process in Texas is 30% more energy-efficient and cost-competitive, while Electra uses renewable energy for low-carbon iron. These developments signal a promising, decarbonized future for U.S. steel amid rising investor interest.

title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 1.14% Lower at $5.7885 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for January delivery fell 6.70 cents per pound, or 1.14%, to $5.7885 over the week, down two of the past three weeks. It declined 15.95 cents or 2.68% on the day, marking the largest one-day drop since January 7, 2026. Year-to-date, it is up 2.82%.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.79 USD/Lbs on January 16, down 3.40% from the previous day, amid reports of drops due to China curbing high-frequency trading and retreating from record highs. Over the past month, prices rose 7.88%, and year-over-year up 33.95%. Historically, it reached an all-time high of 6.11 USD/Lbs in January 2026.

title: Copper hits one-week low on profit-taking and China demand concerns
summary: Copper prices hit a one-week low on Friday due to profit-taking after a rally driven by speculative funds. Physical demand from buyers in China remained muted. This reflects recent market volatility in the commodity.

title: Copper theft ticks up as prices surge
summary: Copper thefts are increasing as prices surge, highlighting secondary market impacts of rising copper values. The video discusses trends in theft related to high commodity prices.

title: First Quantum nears stockpile processing at Cobre Panama copper mine
summary: First Quantum Minerals is preparing to process stockpiled ore at its Cobre Panama mine, expected to yield 70,000 tonnes of copper to offset 2026 preservation costs. The company revised its copper production guidance downward slightly for 2026-2028, with 375,000-435,000 tonnes projected this year. Panama's government has initiated a care and maintenance plan, including power plant restarts to support activities.

title: CMOC bets on copper growth, maintains cobalt target
summary: Chinese miner CMOC Group plans double-digit copper production growth in 2026, targeting 760,000-820,000 tons this year after profits rose from higher prices. The company maintained cobalt output guidance at 100,000-120,000 tons following a 2025 record. This expansion aligns with peers like Zijin Mining amid supply concerns for electrification demand.

title: Amazon to be first user of copper made by Rio Tinto venture
summary: Amazon Web Services will be the first to use copper produced at an Arizona mine using Nuton's bioleaching technology, which uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulfide ores. The technology reduces water usage by up to 80% and carbon emissions by as much as 60% compared to traditional copper production, while achieving recovery rates of up to 85%.

title: Driving innovation at Escondida
summary: BHP highlights innovation and autonomous operations at Escondida, the world's largest copper concentrates and cathodes producer in Chile. The company emphasizes how technology and autonomous operations address industry challenges such as declining ore grades and increasing operational complexity.

title: 'Substantial Shortfall' in Copper Supply Widens as the Race for AI and Growing Defense Spending Add to Accelerating Demand
summary: A new S&P Global study warns that copper supply is not on track to meet accelerating demand from electrification, AI computation, and defense spending. The study estimates that an additional 10 million metric tons of primary supply will be required by 2040, with new mines and expanded recycling critical to closing the supply gap.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 17,825 USD/T on January 16, 2026, down 4.14% from the previous day, though up 24.09% over the past month. A later update shows prices at 17,566.63 USD/T, down 5.53% daily but up 22.29% monthly and 9.25% year-over-year. This reflects ongoing volatility amid broader market trends.

title: SMM Battery-Grade Nickel Sulphate Prices Rise on January 17
summary: On January 17, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price reached 26,516 yuan/mt. Quotations for battery-grade nickel sulphate showed an upward trend. This indicates rising prices in nickel derivatives amid recent market dynamics.

title: Nickel Price Extends Drop Amid Lack of Detail on Indonesia Output Cuts
summary: Nickel prices settled 4.1% lower at $17,155 per ton on the LME, extending declines from a 19-month high due to absent details on Indonesia's output cuts. Three-month futures dropped as much as 5.9% after peaking at $18,800 per ton. The pullback follows a rally driven by supply concerns from the top producer.

title: Live Nickel Prices Today
summary: Nickel prices retreated on January 17, 2026, as markets reassessed Indonesia's proposed output cuts. This follows recent volatility in the nickel market. The analysis highlights ongoing price adjustments amid supply uncertainties.

title: Nickel Supply Squeeze Intensifies as Indonesia Restricts Exports and Canada Accelerates Projects
summary: Nickel prices surged to $18,650 following Indonesian supply restrictions confirmed by Vale's mining halt. Canada Nickel's Crawford project received Ontario's fast-track approval as a strategic alternative, while the Reid deposit resource increased 46% to 5 million tonnes of contained nickel with superior economics.

title: FLASH: Indonesia's ESDM confirms plan to reduce nickel production to 250-260 million tonnes for 2026
summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources confirmed a nickel production target of 250-260 million tonnes for 2026, down from 379 million tonnes in 2025. The quota reduction aims to align with domestic processing capacity and support nickel prices, with global prices surging to $18,000/tonne following the announcement.

title: Can nickel prices hit $25,000 in 2026?
summary: Nickel prices jumped to $16,500–$18,500 per ton in early January 2026, with Indonesia shifting from maximizing supply to maximizing value through production cuts. Only 55% of Indonesia's approved nickel ore production capacity was actually utilized in 2025, suggesting much of the supposed surplus was statistical illusion.

title: Indonesian Mining Restrictions Send Shockwaves Through Global Markets
summary: The nickel market experienced significant volatility in early 2026, with prices climbing $2,200 per ton to $18,650 following Vale's announcement of mining permit delays in Indonesia. Market observers anticipate prices could reach $20,000 per ton during the January-March quarter as Chinese processors face mounting pressure to secure material.

title: Indonesia quota talk triggers nickel reality check
summary: Nickel's price surged nearly 9% on January 6 to $18,524 per tonne, the highest level since mid-2024, driven by reports of Indonesia cutting ore production quotas by about a third. However, a large warranting of nickel onto the LME on January 7 reminded markets that nickel still faces near-term oversupply concerns.

title: First Atlantic Nickel Highlights Relevance of Pipestone XL Awaruite Nickel-Cobalt Alloy Discovery to Address U.S. Critical Mineral Supply Chain Vulnerabilities
summary: First Atlantic Nickel announced preliminary metallurgical testing results for its Pipestone XL project, with magnetic concentrate averaging 1.3% nickel that can be upgraded to approximately 60% through flotation. The project also identified chromium as a potential recoverable mineral, addressing North America's lack of sufficient mined chromium concentrates.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicles and green energy. The project uses the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste, making it a carbon-negative facility. It supports robust supply chains for critical metals essential to the net-zero transition.

title: Arca and Giga Metals sign exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal at B.C. nickel project with potential to remove 220 million tonnes of atmospheric carbon dioxide
summary: Arca and Giga Metals have signed an exclusive agreement to evaluate carbon removal using ultramafic waste rock and mine tailings at the Turnagain nickel project in British Columbia. Arca's Industrial Mineralization technology accelerates carbon mineralization, potentially removing up to 220 million tonnes of CO2 over the project's lifetime from 1.3 billion tonnes of material. This supports high ESG credentials for nickel production aligned with Canada's critical minerals strategy.

title: Arca and Giga Metals sign exclusive agreement to explore carbon removal at B.C. nickel project with potential to remove 220 million tonnes of atmospheric carbon dioxide
summary: Giga Metals and Arca are partnering on the Turnagain project to deploy carbon mineralization technology on ultramafic materials, aiming to sequester 220 million tonnes of CO2 while producing nickel. The initiative enhances mine sustainability, waste valorization, and project economics, positioning Canada as a leader in critical minerals with ESG focus. Executives highlight it as a new mining paradigm combining mineral development with permanent carbon removal.

title: Arca & Giga Metals To Explore CDR At Nickel Mine In Canada
summary: Arca Climate Technologies has a 10-year exclusive agreement to assess carbon dioxide removal potential at Giga Metals' Turnagain nickel project using ultramafic waste. The technology accelerates CO2 mineralization, targeting 220 million tonnes of removal, and builds on a decade of collaboration for ESG-enhanced nickel production. This aligns with Canada's critical minerals priorities and demonstrates innovative mining with societal benefits.

title: Nickel market set for steady growth as stainless steel and ev demand reshape supply
summary: The nickel market anticipates steady growth driven by stainless steel and EV battery demand, with acceleration in battery-grade refinery projects in North America for lower-carbon supply chains. Sustainability pressures are intensifying, as automakers enforce stricter emissions standards, promoting renewable energy, traceability, and cleaner methods in nickel production. Investment momentum persists despite some project delays, shaped by long-term forecasts.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy
summary: Tenaris, Snam, and Tenova launched the first trial in Italy using hydrogen at a steel plant to process steel products at Tenaris's Dalmine mill in Bergamo. The six-month collaboration aims to evaluate the performance and reliability of hydrogen in the steel industry and develop safety guidelines for hard-to-abate sectors, supporting Tenaris's goal to reduce carbon footprint by 30% by 2030.

title: Tenaris invests in its Italian steel shop to produce Super 13
summary: Tenaris's steel shop in Dalmine, Italy, invested nearly 29 million dollars to expand the facility's capabilities to produce specialty steels with high performance characteristics.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted yesterday at company offices, supported by Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% in response, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
